title: Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 Method (Original - Detailed)
preparation_steps: Grind 20 grams of coffee to a medium-coarse setting.
Rinse filter and preheat the V60 brewer.
Add 20 g coffee and level the bed for even extraction.

brewing_steps.instruction: First pour: Add 60 g of water steadily over the grounds. This initial pour acts as bloom and begins extraction, shaping the balance between sweetness and acidity.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 18 seconds to pour 60 grams of water steadily over the grounds. Wet all the coffee evenly to set the foundation for sweetness and acidity.
brewing_steps.instruction_es: Primer vertido (0:00): Vierte 60g de agua. Este primer vertido controla el equilibrio dulzura-acidez.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia tu cronómetro y vierte 60 gramos de agua. Este primer vertido es crucial - controla el equilibrio entre dulzura y acidez en tu taza final. Espera hasta los 45 segundos.

brewing_steps.instruction: Second pour: Add another 60 g of water evenly across the bed. Together with the first pour, these 40% of total water control the balance of acidity and sweetness in the cup.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 27 seconds to pour another 60 grams evenly across the bed. These first two pours decide whether the cup leans toward sweetness or acidity.
brewing_steps.instruction_es: Segundo vertido (0:45): Vierte otros 60g de agua (total: 120g). Este completa la fase de acidez/dulzura.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: A los 45 segundos, vierte otros 60 gramos de agua, llevando el total a 120 gramos. Esto completa la primera fase que controla la acidez y dulzura. Espera hasta el minuto 1:30.

brewing_steps.instruction: Third pour: Add 60 g of water with a steady flow. This pour starts shaping the body and clarity of the brew, guiding overall texture.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 45 seconds to add 60 grams with a steady flow. From here, pours begin to shape body and clarity.
brewing_steps.instruction_es: Tercer vertido (1:30): Vierte 60g de agua (total: 180g). Comienza la fase de fuerza.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Tercer vertido a 180g total • Fase de fuerza
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Al minuto 1:30, vierte 60 gramos más, llevando el total a 180 gramos. Esto comienza la segunda fase que controla la fuerza de tu café.

brewing_steps.instruction: Fourth pour: Add 60 g of water evenly. Maintain a consistent flow to keep extraction balanced and avoid channeling.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 45 seconds to pour another 60 grams evenly. Keep your flow consistent to maintain a balanced extraction.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: A los 2 minutos 15 segundos, vierte otros 60 gramos, llevando el total a 240 gramos.

brewing_steps.instruction: Final pour: Add the last 60 g of water gently. Allow the bed to settle naturally as the extraction completes.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 45 seconds to finish with the last 60 grams, pouring gently. Let the bed settle naturally as extraction completes.
brewing_steps.instruction_es: Quinto vertido (3:00): Vierte los últimos 60g de agua (total: 300g). Espera el drenaje completo.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Al minuto 3, vierte los últimos 60 gramos para alcanzar tu total de 300 gramos. Ahora espera a que el café drene completamente. El tiempo total de preparación debería ser alrededor de 3 minutos 30 segundos.

brewing_steps.instruction: Let the coffee drain fully. The total brew time should finish around 3 minutes 30 seconds, producing a clean and balanced cup.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 30 seconds to let the coffee drain completely. Allow it to finish naturally for a clean, balanced cup.
brewing_steps.instruction_es: Deja que el café drene completamente. El tiempo total debería ser alrededor de 3 minutos 30 segundos.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 30 segundos para dejar que el café drene completamente. Permite que termine naturalmente para una taza limpia y equilibrada.

what_to_expect.description: The 4:6 method by 2016 World Brewers Cup Champion Tetsu Kasuya is a revolutionary technique that gives you direct control over sweetness, acidity, and strength. The first 40% of water (120g in two 60g pours) controls the balance between sweetness and acidity—equal pours yield balance, adjusting the ratio shifts the profile. The remaining 60% (three 60g pours) determines body and strength. Expect a clean, structured cup with remarkable clarity and the ability to dial in your preferred flavor profile. This method works exceptionally well with washed coffees and medium roasts, producing a balanced cup that highlights origin characteristics without overwhelming complexity. The systematic approach makes it easier to reproduce consistent results once you find your preferred split.
what_to_expect.audio_script: The Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 method is a revolutionary brewing technique that puts you in control. The first 40% of your water—that's the first two pours of 60 grams each—controls the balance between sweetness and acidity. Equal pours give you balance, while adjusting this ratio lets you dial in your preferred flavor. The remaining 60%, split into three pours, determines the body and strength of your cup. Expect a clean, structured coffee with remarkable clarity. This method works exceptionally well with washed coffees and medium roasts, highlighting origin characteristics with consistency and precision.
what_to_expect.description_es: El método 4:6 de Tetsu Kasuya, ganador del Campeonato Mundial de Baristas 2016, te da control completo sobre el perfil de sabor de tu café. Al dividir el agua en proporciones de 40% (dos vertidos) y 60% (tres vertidos), puedes ajustar la dulzura, acidez y fuerza de tu taza. Es un método versátil que funciona bien con todo tipo de cafés.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: El método 4:6 de Tetsu Kasuya es revolucionario porque te da control total sobre el sabor de tu café. Al dividir el agua en dos fases, 40 por ciento y 60 por ciento, puedes ajustar la dulzura, acidez y fuerza según tus preferencias. Perfecto para experimentar y encontrar tu perfil de sabor ideal.

notes: Based on Tetsu Kasuya's 2016 World Brewers Cup winning method. The key innovation is the systematic control over flavor variables through water distribution. Adjust the first two pours (40% total) to shift sweetness/acidity balance, and modify the number of remaining pours (keeping 60% total) to control strength.
title_es: Método 4:6 de Tetsu Kasuya para V60
notes_es: El famoso método 4:6 te permite ajustar el perfil de sabor dividiendo el vertido total en dos fases: 40% para dulzura/acidez y 60% para fuerza. Molienda gruesa, agua a 92°C.
preparation_steps_es: Muele 20 gramos de café a molienda gruesa.
Enjuaga el filtro de papel con agua caliente y descarta.
Añade el café al V60 y nivela la cama.
Prepara el servidor debajo del V60.
